main event: A stationary object was observed for 1 hour in Webster, Massachusetts on September 6, 1964.
interesting points: The object was previously sighted and reported by the same observer on a previous weekday.
The object was evaluated as an 'unidentified' sighting (code 331 DGO).

A pilot and co-pilot from Boston Center reported observing a well-defined object of light red or purple color emitting intense light, which hovered momentarily and then accelerated and disappeared rapidly.
Search and recovery operations were immediately instituted by Wright-Patterson AFB.
The object was tracked visually for approximately 1 hour.
